title: “Quarto Basics” format: html: code-fold: true jupyter: python3 —
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis





Updated on github One more change

title: Projects
text:
Worked on developing feasible algorithms for numerical simulations of micromaterials with embedded nanopores in three-dimensional space without sacrificing time and spatial performance. We accomplished this through existing meshing strategies consisting of adaptive refinement and coarsening, our mesh approximation algorithm, and bounding volume hierarchy (BVH) algorithms. 
Digitally recreated foam from experiments.

title: Projects
text:
Worked on developing feasible algorithms for numerical simulations of micromaterials with embedded nanopores in three-dimensional space without sacrificing time and spatial performance. We accomplished this through existing meshing strategies consisting of adaptive refinement and coarsening, our mesh approximation algorithm, and bounding volume hierarchy (BVH) algorithms. 
Digitally recreated foam from experiments.

title: Projects
text:
Geometrical approximation of meshes (2025)
Constructed meshing reassignment algorithms to approximate complex porous regions and geometries. Achieved the following computational feats:


Approximated geometries from same initial STL file

title: Projects
section: Modeling and simulation of coronary stents (2023)
text:
Modeling and simulation of coronary stents (2023)
In this project, we developed multi-domain modeling of coronary stents taking into account the full interplay among the wall, lumen, and struts through fluid-structure interactions. 












Paper (ACSE 2024) 
Stent Modeling

title: Irving Martínez Acosta
text:
About
I am a mathematical scientist working on applied mathematics, scientific computing, and modeling. My interests include numerical analysis, PDEs, inverse problems, and data‑driven methods.
I focus on bridging mathematical theory with computational practice, with applications in physics and engineering.
